title: HW4 Q7
content: Context: This problem analyzes the behavior of weights and gradients of a convolutional layer in detail. You will be asked to:Derive the gradient of a weight matrix as a weighted average of image patchesAnalyze the mean and std of the gradientShow the effect of pooling on the gradient and in particular, how max pooling routes gradients. It is important to understand this here because the story in transformers is related.

Context: This problem analyzes the behavior of weights and gradients of a convolutional layer in detail. You will be asked to:

Derive the gradient of a weight matrix as a weighted average of image patches

Analyze the mean and std of the gradient

Show the effect of pooling on the gradient and in particular, how max pooling routes gradients. It is important to understand this here because the story in transformers is related.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>For the 2x2 max pooling and average pooling layers, is the stride 2?</paragraph></document>
comments.document: For the 2x2 max pooling and average pooling layers, is the stride 2?

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>The default assumption with pooling layers is that they are used for downsampling (as much as possible) and will look at every pixel in the previous layer. Does that answer your question?</paragraph><paragraph/></document>
